permits.how_to_description: 1. Complete the Mobile Food Facility (MFF) application form online or obtain a paper copy from your local Environmental Health Department. 2. Ensure your vehicle passes a plan check review - submit detailed plans including equipment layout, plumbing, and electrical systems. 3. Obtain a business license from your city or county. 4. Complete a food handler certification course (all staff who handle food). 5. Schedule and pass a vehicle inspection with the local health department. 6. Provide proof of liability insurance ($1M minimum). 7. Submit all documentation and payment to the Environmental Health Department. 8. Once approved, display permit visibly on your vehicle.
permits.eligibility: Any individual or business operating a mobile food facility in California. Must be at least 18 years old and have a valid business license.
permits.document_requirements: Mobile Food Facility application, Vehicle plan check approval, Business license, Food handler certification (all staff), Certificate of insurance ($1M liability), Vehicle registration, Commissary letter of agreement, Water tank certification

permits.how_to_description: 1. Choose your business structure (sole proprietorship, LLC, corporation, etc.). 2. For LLCs and corporations, file formation documents with the California Secretary of State online at bizfilesonline.sos.ca.gov. 3. Obtain an Employer Identification Number (EIN) from the IRS if you have employees or operate as a corporation/partnership. 4. Register with the California Department of Tax and Fee Administration for seller's permit if selling goods. 5. Apply for a city or county business license/tax certificate from your local jurisdiction. 6. Check if your business requires additional permits based on industry (health permits, professional licenses, etc.). 7. Register for state employer taxes if you have employees. 8. Maintain good standing by filing required annual reports and paying renewal fees.
permits.deadline_window: Must be obtained before starting business operations. Annual renewal varies by jurisdiction.
permits.eligibility: Any individual or entity conducting business in California. Requirements vary based on business structure and industry.
permits.document_requirements: Business name (DBA if applicable), Business structure documentation, EIN letter from IRS, Physical business address, Owner identification (driver's license or passport), Industry-specific permits/licenses

permits.how_to_description: 1. Meet minimum requirements: be at least 18 years old and have 4 years of journey-level experience in the trade you're applying for. 2. Create an account on the CSLB website and submit an application online. 3. Complete the Application for Original Contractor License (13A-1) form. 4. Schedule and pass two exams: Law & Business exam and your trade-specific exam. 5. Submit fingerprints for a criminal background check. 6. Provide financial documents showing $2,500 minimum operating capital (more for certain license classifications). 7. Obtain a contractor's bond ($25,000 for most licenses). 8. Pay all required fees including application fee, initial license fee, and examination fees. 9. Designate a Responsible Managing Employee (RME) or Responsible Managing Officer (RMO) if applicable. 10. Once approved, maintain your license through continuing education and timely renewals every 2 years.
permits.deadline_window: Apply at least 3-4 months before you need to start contracting work. License must be renewed every 2 years.
permits.eligibility: Individuals or businesses performing construction work in California with contracts valued at $500 or more (labor and materials combined). Must have 4 years journey-level experience and pass required exams.
permits.document_requirements: Completed application form, Proof of 4 years journey-level experience, Social Security number or ITIN, Fingerprints for background check, Contractor's bond ($25,000), Certificate of workers' compensation insurance or exemption, Proof of operating capital ($2,500+), Trade exam and Law & Business exam passage
